Description: Ostracon, large section (three fragments joined) of the body of brown-grey pottery meat-jar, the fabric contains a large number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text giving the destination of the contents.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393518) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393518)
